cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 mi ENE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn northwest, cross central/western Cuba Monday, enter the Florida Straits, move northward along/near Florida’s west coast Tuesday–Wednesday, then curve across Georgia/South Carolina toward the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast (likely near the Big Bend/Tampa region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-Storm and Hurricane watches presently limited to Cuba, Cayman Islands, and portions of the Florida Keys
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-Storm warnings for Jamaica and eastern/central Cuba; none yet for Georgia coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern and eastern Gulf of Mexico coast, then southeastern U.S. coast from Florida through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Up to tropical-storm-force gusts (34–45 kt) possible late Wednesday into early Thursday with a 19% cumulative chance
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (generally <3 ft) cannot be ruled out but significant surge is not expected for Savannah given inland storm track
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain 2–4 inches with localized totals up to 6 inches could cause urban and low-lying flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain bands; short-period squalls reducing visibility for port operations
